top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 104, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Unbound Gravel 100's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
Unbound Gravel 100's Flint rock roads, Chunky gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 104 miles.
When someone attacks on flint Hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Unbound Gravel 100's flint Hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 104 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Unbound Gravel 100, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Unbound Gravel 100. Train it until it feels boring.
At Unbound Gravel 100, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
104 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on flint Hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,000ft of climbing on flint Hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.heat: June in Emporia, Kansas — Late May/early June in Kansas means 85-95°F highs with high humidity. Full sun exposure on open prairies. Thunderstorms are a perennial threat. The 2023 edition saw brutal mud conditions in the morning. 'Whatever brutal weather Kansas decides to serve up.'. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Unbound Gravel 100 — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day. Race-day realities: Extreme heat (85-100°F possible); High humidity causing fluid loss.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Unbound Gravel 100’s 104 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Unbound Gravel 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on flint hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires and spirits to build confidence. Expect: flint rock roads, chunky gravel, paved transfers.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 104 miles of flint hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires and spirits in Emporia, Kansas.
